text.*:
This article is an orphan, as no other articles link to it. Please introduce links to this page from related articles; try the Find link tool for suggestions. (March 2017)

This is a list of assassinated serving ambassadors.[1][2]

List[edit]

Name Ambassador Place Country Date of death Killed by
Antonio Rincon French Ambassador to the Ottoman Empire Rivoli  Republic of Venice July 3, 1541 Venetian Imperial Guard
Alexander Griboyedov Russian Ambassador to Persia Tehran  Iran February 11, 1829 Iranian mob
Clemens von Ketteler German Ambassadors to China Beijing  China June 20, 1900 Boxer rebel
Wilhelm von Mirbach German Ambassador to Russia Moscow  Russia June 6, 1918 killed by Left Socialist Revolutionaries
Pyotr Voykov Soviet Ambassadors to Poland Warsaw  Poland June 7, 1927 Boris Kowerda
Henry Gurney United Kingdom High Commissioner in Malaya Fraser's Hill  Malaya October 6, 1951 killed by Malayan Communist Party
John Mein United States Ambassador to Guatemala Guatemala City  Guatemala August 28, 1968 killed by Rebel Armed Forces
Karl von Spreti German Ambassador to Guatemala May 4, 1970
Vladimir Rolović Yugoslav Ambassador to Sweden Stockholm  Sweden April 15, 1971 killed by Croatian National Resistance
Cleo Noel United States Ambassador to Sudan Khartoum  Sudan February 3, 1973 killed by Black September
Rodger Davies United States Ambassador to Cyprus Nicosia  Cyprus August 19, 1974 killed by EOKA B
İsmail Erez Turkish Ambassador to France Paris  France October 24, 1975 killed by Armenian Secret Army for the Liberation of Armenia
Daniş Tunalıgil Turkish Ambassador to Austria Vienna  Austria October 11, 1975 killed by Justice Commandos of the Armenian Genocide
Carlos Abdala Uruguayan Ambassador to Paraguay Asuncion  Paraguay June 8, 1976 killed by Croatian terrorists
Christopher Ewart-Biggs United Kingdom Ambassador to the Republic of Ireland Dublin  Ireland June 21, 1976 killed by Provisional Irish Republican Army
Francis Meloy United States Ambassador to Lebanon Beirut  Lebanon June 16, 1976 killed by Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine
Taha Carım Turkish Ambassador to Holy See Rome  Italy June 9, 1977 killed by Justice Commandos of the Armenian Genocide
Adolph Dubs United States Ambassador to Afghanistan Kabul  Afghanistan February 14, 1979 killed by Settam-e-Melli
Richard Sykes United Kingdom Ambassador to the Netherlands Hague  Netherlands March 22, 1979 killed by Provisional Irish Republican Army
Archibald Gardner Dunn South African Ambassador to El Salvador San Salvador  El Salvador October 8, 1980 Fuerzas Populares de Liberación Farabundo Martí
Louis Delamare French Ambassador to Lebanon Beirut  Lebanon September 5, 1981 Pro-Iranian hitmen
Shlomo Argov Israel Ambassador to the United Kingdom London  United Kingdom February 24, 2003
(Assassination June 3, 1982)		 killed by Abu Nidal Organization
Galip Balkar Turkish Ambassador to Yugoslavia Belgrade  Yugoslavia March 9, 1983 killed by Justice Commandos of the Armenian Genocide
Lee Gye-cheol South Korean Ambassador to Burma Rangoon  Burma October 9, 1983 North Korean agents
Saleh Mehdi Amash Iraqi Ambassador to Finland Helsinki  Finland January 30, 1985 Iraqi agents
Arnold Raphel United States Ambassador to Pakistan Bahawalpur  Pakistan August 17, 1988 plane crash
Pedro Manuel de Aristegui Spanish Ambassador to Lebanon Beirut  Lebanon April 16, 1989 killed by a rocket
Michael Courtney Apostolic Nuncio to Burundi Bujumbura  Burundi December 29, 2003 killed by National Forces of Liberation
J. Christopher Stevens United States Ambassador to Libya Benghazi  Libya September 11, 2012 killed by Ansar al-Sharia
Kyriakos Amiridis Greek Ambassador to Brazil Nova Iguaçu  Brazil December 26, 2016 Sérgio Moreira
Andrei Karlov Russian Ambassador to Turkey Ankara  Turkey December 19, 2016 Mevlüt Mert Altıntaş

References[edit]

  1. ^ "US Ambassadors Killed in the Line of Duty". Associated Press. 2012-09-12. Retrieved 2012-09-12. 
  2. ^ "How many U.S. Ambassadors have been killed by militants?". Office of the Historian, Bureau of Public Affairs United States Department of State.
